title: Eurocode 2 Reinforcement Anchorage & Lap Length Calculator

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Concrete design tensile strength: $$ f_{ctd} = \dfrac{f_{ctk,0.05}}{\gamma_c} $$ Design bond strength: $$ f_{bd} = 2.25 \cdot \eta_1 \cdot \eta_2 \cdot f_{ctd} $$ with \( \eta_1 = 1.0 \) for good bond (otherwise 0.7) and \( \eta_2 = \begin{cases} 1.0 & \phi \le 32\text{ mm} \\ \max\left(0.7,\frac{132-\phi}{100}\right) & \phi > 32\text{ mm} \end{cases} \) Basic required anchorage length: $$ l_{b,req} = \dfrac{\phi}{4}\,\dfrac{\sigma_{sd}}{f_{bd}} $$ where \( \sigma_{sd} \le \dfrac{f_{yk}}{\gamma_s} \). Design anchorage length: $$ l_{bd} = \max\!\Big(\alpha \cdot l_{b,req},\; l_{b,min}\Big) $$ with a simplified product of detailing coefficients \( \alpha \ge 0.7 \) and $$ l_{b,min} = \max\!\big(0.3\,l_{b,req},\; 10\phi,\; 100\text{ mm}\big). $$ Design lap length (tension/compression splice): $$ l_0 = \max\!\Big(\alpha_{lap}\cdot l_{b,req},\; l_{0,min}\Big) $$ with $$ l_{0,min} = \begin{cases} \max\!\big(0.3\,l_0,\; 15\phi,\; 200\text{ mm}\big) & \text{tension} \\ \max\!\big(0.3\,l_0,\; 10\phi,\; 100\text{ mm}\big) & \text{compression} \end{cases} $$ Note: Project- and clause-specific Î±-factors may apply (bar shape, confinement, percentage lapped, etc.).
